20.m: For by grace you have been saved through faith. And this is not your own doing; it is the gift of God, not a result of works, so that no one may boast. - Ephesians 2:8 (ESV)

l.q: What do verses 1-3 tell us about man's spiritual condition?
l.a: Verses 1-3 tell us that we were spiritually dead in our trespasses and sins. We do not follow God but follow instead the passions of our flesh.

l.q: What do verses 4-7 tell us about God?
l.a: Verses 4-7 tell us that God is rich in mercy and he loves us, even while we are yet sinners. He graciously provided us His Son, Jesus Christ, so that He may share with us the immeasurable riches of His grace in the coming ages.

l.q: What do verses 8-10 tell us about salvation?
l.a: Verses 8-10 tell us that a person is saved by God's grace through faith. It is not by works or a person's own doing. Salvation in Christ is an underserved gift from God. But we are created by God in Jesus Christ to do good works beforehand.

20.p: Lord God, you alone are holy. Who can measure up to your standards? Sometimes even in my best intentions I can still sin against you and others unknowingly. But thank you for your mercy, thank you for Jesus Christ. Thank you for the forgiveness of sins in Christ, our hope and life.
